title: Alternating Terms
text: The terms alternate between positive and negative. Use $${\left(-1\right)}^n$$ to make the terms alternate.
speech: The terms alternate between positive and negative. Use , parentheses negative 1  to the n-th  to make the terms alternate.
pacedSpeech: The terms alternate between positive and negative. Use  ,  negative 1  to the n-th

title: Pattern Among Terms
text: Notice that the absolute values of terms increase by a multiple of $$9$$. $$9$$ is multiplied by $$9$$ to make $$81$$, $$81$$ is multiplied by $$9$$ to make $$729$$ etc. Use $$9^n$$ to represent this.
speech: Notice that the absolute values of terms increase by a multiple of  9 .  9  is multiplied by  9  to make  81 ,  81  is multiplied by  9  to make  729  etc. Use  9 to the n-th  to represent this.
pacedSpeech: Notice that the absolute values of terms increase by a multiple of   9

title: Putting it together
text: Multiply your two results together to get your answer.
speech: Multiply your two results together to get your answer.
pacedSpeech: Multiply your two results together to get your answer.
